Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following: (c)
Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care, safety, and
1

supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation and Additional Findings
Type of Non-Compliance
Allegations Allegation #1
Staff 1 was utilizing her personal cell phone during work hours and
in the presence of youth.
Allegation #2
Staff 1 advised Youth A that she would adopt her.
Allegation #3
Staff failed to follow the agency policy regarding responding to
self-harming behavior by youth.
Allegation #4
Staff failed to complete an Incident Report documenting the
behavior of Youth A.
Allegation #5
The staff member gave the youth over $400.00 worth of gifts over
a period of time.
Investigation Interviews:
Allegation #1
On 06/05/2025 an onsite visit was made to Vista Maria. An
interview was completed with Compliance. He was advised of
the allegations. He confirmed that Youth A is no longer placed at
the agency. A request was made for all related incident reports
involving Youth A and Staff 1.
On 06/05/2025 an email was sent to Chief Administrator (CA).
She was advised of the initiation of a new investigation and
advised of the allegations.
On 06/05/2025 a voicemail message was left for Foster Care
Worker (FCW) of Youth A advising of DCWL investigation. A
request was made for a return call with any additional concerns
regarding youth and placement at Vista Maria. To date, no
response was received.
2

On 06/05/2025 a telephone call was made to assigned DHHS
Specialist. Allegations of case were discussed. She provided
contact information for Worker 2 who is an advocate for Youth A.
On 06/05/2025 a telephone call was made to Worker 2. She
reported that she speaks with Youth A daily. She reported Youth
A advised her that Staff 1 allows Youth A to talk on Staff 1’s cell
phone while she is at work.
On 06/05/2025 a telephone call was made to Complainant. No
additional concerns were reported.
On 06/11/2025 an onsite visit was made to Visita Maria. DHHS
Specialist was also present. An interview was completed with
Staff 1. Staff 1 admitted to using her cell phone on the wing and
acknowledged that this is against agency policy but denied ever
allowing Youth A to use her phone.
On 06/11/2025 an in-person meeting was held with Staff 2 at
Vista Maria. DHHS Specialist was also present. Staff 2 confirmed
that she has seen staff on their personal phones while at work.
On 06/24/2025 and 07/11/2025 voicemail messages were left for
Staff 3 requesting a return call. To date no response has been
received.
On 06/24/2025 a voicemail message was left for Staff 4
requesting a return call. On 07/11/2025 an attempted call was
unsuccessful. A recording indicated the contact number was
inoperable.
On 07/22/2025 a telephone interview was completed with
Therapist. She denied having knowledge or seeing Staff 1 utilize
her cell phone at work. She also denied Youth A reported to her
that Staff 1 allowed use of her cell phone.
On 07/22/2025 a telephone interview was completed with
Supervisor 1. She denied having knowledge or seeing Staff 1
utilize her cell phone at work. She also denied that Youth A
reported to her that Staff 1 allowed use of her cell phone.
On 07/23/2025 an in-person interview was completed with Youth
B at Vista Maria. She confirmed that she has seen Staff 1 utilize
her cell phone at work. She denied that she has ever been
allowed to use Staff 1’s phone or seeing Staff 1 allow Youth A use
her phone.
3

On 07/23/2025 an in-person interview was held with Youth C at
Vista Maria. She denied ever seeing Staff 1 utilize her cell phone
at work and denied that Staff 1 has ever allowed youth to utilize
her cell phone.
Documents Reviewed:
Vista Maria Employee Behavior Policy: Personal cell phone use is
only permitted during scheduled breaks and are not allowed while
in the presence of clients in any residential program.
DHHS Specialist 2 Social Work Contact: Dated 06/11/2025.
Youth A reported that Staff 1 would always be on her cell phone
talking to someone.
DHHS Specialist 1 Social Work Contact: Dated 06/23/2025. Staff
3 denied seeing Staff 1 on her cell phone at work and denied
Youth A has never mentioned talking to strangers on anyone's
phone.
DHHS Specialist 1 Social Work Contact: Dated 06/23/2025. Staff
4 denied seeing Staff 1 on her cell phone at work.
Allegation #2:
On 06/05/2025 a telephone call was made to Worker 2. She
reported that she speaks with Youth A daily. She reported Youth
A advised her that Staff 1 told her she would adopt her and
allowed her to speak with an unknown male via telephone who
also reported that they were going to adopt her.
On 06/11/2025 an onsite visit was made to Visita Maria. DHHS
Specialist was also present. An interview was completed with
Staff 1. Staff 1 initially reported that she did advise Youth A that
she would not mind adopting her but later indicated that Youth A
asked her to adopt her, to which she responded that she wouldn’t
mind.
On 06/11/2025 an in-person meeting was held with Staff 2 at
Vista Maria. DHHS Specialist was also present. Staff 2 reported
that Youth A came to her about two weeks ago and expressed
some concerns regarding Staff 1. She reported that Youth A
stated she felt “stuck and confused”. Staff 2 further reported that
Youth A told her Staff 1 said that she was going to adopt her.
Staff 2 denied that she ever heard any of the conversations or
witnessed anything reported by Youth A.
4

On 07/23/2025 an in-person interview was completed with Youth
B at Vista Maria. She confirmed Youth A told her that Staff 1
stated she wanted to adopt Youth A. Youth B also reported she
overheard Staff 1 say that she wanted to adopt Youth A. She was
unable to recall when and where she overheard this statement.
On 07/23/2025 an in-person interview was held with Youth C at
Vista Maria. She denied ever being told by Youth A or hearing
Staff 1 indicate a plan or desire to adopt Youth A.
Documents Reviewed:
Vista Maria Employee Behavior Policy: Demonstrate behavior that
exhibits respectful and professional boundaries, at all times.
DHHS Specialist 2 Social Work Contact: Dated 06/11/2025.
Youth A reported that Staff 1 would put her on the phone with an
unknown male and he would reference her as “daughter”.
DHHS Specialist 1 Social Work Contact: Dated 06/23/2025. Staff
3 reported that Staff 1 did mention to her that she was considering
taking in Youth A to her own home. She denied hearing Staff 1
say this to Youth A.
Allegation #3
On 06/11/2025 an onsite visit was made to Visita Maria. DHHS
Specialist was also present. An interview was completed with
Staff 1. Staff 1 reported that Youth A was upset and was in the
restroom and would not come out. Staff 1 heard something hit the
floor in the bathroom and called Staff 4 to assist. Staff 1 and Staff
4 went into the bathroom together and Youth A was in the stall
with the door closed. Staff 1 reported she opened the door and
saw Youth A attempting to harm herself with a piece of the floor
tile. Youth A refused to give the tile to staff and refused to exit the
bathroom. Staff 1 reported she was able to convince Youth A to
give her the broken tile and exit the bathroom. Staff 1 reported
after getting Youth A deescalated, she was sent to her room.
Staff 1 confirmed that no intervention was provided to further
assess the attempts of Youth A to self-harm. Staff 1 denied that
Youth A was injured. She also confirmed she did not call anyone
or report the incident to anyone.
On 06/13/2025 an email correspondence was received from
Compliance. He advised that he searched and did not see any
documentation of actions taken by Staff 1 after Youth A made
attempts to self-harm in the bathroom.
5

Documents Reviewed:
Vista Maria Suicide Prevention Policy - Vista Maria takes any
threat of suicide seriously and will take all steps necessary to
prevent suicide among our clients. In the event of a suicide threat
and/or attempt, the shift supervisor must seek immediate medical
attention for the client, if necessary. If immediate medical
attention is not necessary, and if the client cannot be controlled,
the client must be placed on confinement status. If confinement
status is not necessary, the client must be placed on observation
status with at least 15-minute-interval documentation as deemed
appropriate by the therapist/psychiatrist or building manager. If
placed on 100% observation, this will include a staff to accompany
the client throughout the entire shift. The client’s bedroom will be
cleaned out of all personal items for safety and the client will
remain in her bedroom with the staff to monitor activity and
behaviors. Notification. The supervisor must also inform the
Building Manager or on-call Program Manager. The assigned
therapist and psychiatrist will be notified of a client’s suicide
attempt immediately. A client risk evaluation will be performed,
followed by a safety plan of action.
Vista Maria Suicide Prevention Checklist –
Shift Supervisor Responsibilities:
☐ Seek immediate medical attention for the client in the event of a
suicide threat or attempt, if necessary.
☐ Place the client in confinement status if the client cannot de-
escalate but immediate medical attention is not necessary.
☐ Place the client on 100% observation status with 15-minute
interval documentation.
☐ Inform Building Manager or on-call Building Manager,
Therapist, and assigned Psychiatrist of client’s suicide attempt
immediately.
☐ Complete suicide risk assessment tool (if after business hours
or therapist is not available).
☐ Contact Building Manager or On-Call Manager and assigned
Psychiatrist to report on client and their potential suicide risk.
Therapist and/or Supervisor or Team Leader Responsibilities:
☐ Therapist or Supervisor/Team Lead will complete suicide risk
assessment tool (if during business hours – therapist and after 5p,
the Supervisor or Team Leader will complete).
☐ After hours: Supervisor or Team Leader to contact afternoon
nurse from 5p to 8p and on call nurse from 8p to 7a.
☐ Contact Building Manager or On-Call Manager

DHHS Specialist 1 Social Work Contact: Dated 06/23/2025. Staff
3 denied seeing Youth A engage in any self-harming activity.
DHHS Specialist 1 Social Work Contact: Dated 06/23/2025. Staff
4 reported that he recalled when Youth A was in the bathroom
threatening to cut herself and he arrived to assist. Staff 4 stated

Allegation #4
On 06/11/2025 an onsite visit was made to Visita Maria. DHHS
Specialist was also present. An interview was completed with
Staff 1. Staff 1 denied that she reported the behavior of Youth A
while in the bathroom or that she completed an incident report.
On 06/11/2025 an in-person meeting was held with Staff 2 at
Vista Maria. DHHS Specialist was also present. Staff 2 denied
doing an incident report regarding what Youth A reported to her.
Staff 2 reported that she told the youth and family service worker
that she should speak with Youth A about Staff 1. Staff 2 denied
reporting the concerns to anyone else.
On 06/13/2025 an email correspondence was received from
Compliance. He advised that he searched and there were not
any incident reports completed relative to Youth A’s behavior in
the bathroom, nor Staff 2 documenting the concerns that Youth A
expressed to her. He further indicated there were no incident

Documents Reviewed:
Vista Maria Incident Report Policy - Vista Maria employees must
document all Critical Incidents and any irregular campus
occurrences or events that are inconsistent with routine
operations. An Incident Report must be completed immediately
following the incident or as soon as possible before the staff exit
for the day. If the staff is unable to complete the Incident
Report due to urgent or mitigating circumstances, the Shift
Supervisor or Unit/Program Manager must be notified immediately
to ensure completion within twenty-four hours of occurrence.
Video Footage:

There was no video footage available as incident occurred in the
bathroom.
Tour of the Agency:
A tour of the area where incident occurred was unable to be
observed due to the facility being under construction.
Allegation #5
On 06/05/2025 a telephone call was made to Worker 2. She
reported that she speaks with Youth A daily. She reported Youth
A advised her that Staff 1 buys her things and gives her gifts. She
also reported that Youth A stated Staff 1 promised to buy her a
dress.
On 06/11/2025 an onsite visit was made to Visita Maria. DHHS
Specialist was also present. An interview was completed with
Staff 1. Staff 1 reported she provided hair products and press on
nails to Youth A, but that she had the permission of the Therapist.
Staff 1 also confirmed advising Youth A that she would buy her a
dress if her behaviors improved at Vista Maria.
On 06/11/2025 Compliance confirmed with me that it is
appropriate for the Therapist, in addition to the supervisor, to
provide approval based on agency practice.
On 06/11/2025 an in-person meeting was held with Staff 2 at
Vista Maria. DHHS Specialist was also present. Staff 2 reported
that Youth A told her that she felt that Staff 1 was intentionally
working with her in order to “bribe” her. Youth A also reported it
felt “weird and uncomfortable”. Staff 2 said that Youth A told her
Staff 1 would tell her she purchased items for her, but would not
give them to her because of her behavior. Staff 2 denied she ever
heard any of the conversations or witnessed anything reported by
Youth A.
On 07/22/2025 a telephone interview was completed with
Therapist. She confirmed that as part of a reward system, she
approved for Staff 1 to provide Youth A with one pair of short
press-on nails. She denied providing consent for Staff 1 to
provide any additional items, specifically a dress, hair extensions
or candy.
On 07/22/2025 a telephone interview was completed with
Supervisor 1. She denied providing consent for Staff 1 to provide
any items to Youth A. She further reported that she only consents
for items to be brought in for all youth and not for individual youth.
8

On 07/23/2025 an in-person interview was completed with Youth
B at Vista Maria. She confirmed that she has seen Staff 1 provide
items to Youth A such as nails, candy and other items. Youth A
was unable to provide examples of “other items”. She denied that
Staff 1 had ever given her items and stated that she only provided
items to Youth A. Youth B denied knowledge of whether or not
Staff 1 had agency permission to provide the items to Youth A.
On 07/23/2025 an in-person interview was held with Youth C at
Vista Maria. She denied ever seeing Staff 1 provide unauthorized
items to Youth A or any other youth at Vista Maria.
Documents Reviewed:
Vista Maria Employee Behavior Policy: Giving or receiving
gifts/items of value to or from clients without immediate supervisor
approval is prohibited.
DHHS Specialist 2 Social Work Contact: Dated 06/11/2025.
Youth A reported that Staff 1 would buy her all types of things.
She gave examples like snack foods, make up, bedding, and
things of that nature. Youth A reported that Staff 1 just started
asking her questions about things that she liked and started to
bring her things. Youth A denied asking Staff 1 to bring these
items to her. She reported that Staff 1 brought her new press on
nails, hair extensions, candy, and snacks. Youth A stated it would
occur almost daily.
DHHS Specialist 1 Social Work Contact: Dated 06/23/2025. Staff
3 denied ever seeing Youth A receive any gifts from Staff 1.
HR files of Vista Maria Staff:
Staff 1 had no discipline in her HR file
Staff 3 only had disciplinary action documented in his HR file
relative to attendance.
Staff 2 only had disciplinary action documented in her HR file
relative to attendance
Analysis Allegation #1
At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in non-compliance with the licensing rule. Staff 1 admitted to
violating the Vista Maria Employee Behavior Policy by using her
personal cell phone while at work and in the presence of Youth A.
Allegation #2
9

At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in non-compliance with the licensing rule. Staff 1 admitted to
violating the Vista Maria Employee Behavior Policy by telling
Youth A that she wanted to adopt her.
Allegation #3
At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in non-compliance with the licensing rule. Staff 1 admitted that
she did not follow the agency Suicide Prevention Policy after
witnessing Youth A engage in self-harming behavior.
Allegation #4
At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in non-compliance with the licensing rule. Staff 1 failed to
complete an incident report to document the behavior and actions
of Youth A and failed to follow the agency incident report policy.
Allegation #5
At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in non-compliance with the licensing rule. Both staff, youth and
support staff were interviewed. Youth A reported that agency staff
purchased items for her and Staff 1 also confirmed that she
purchased items for Youth A. Supervisor 1 was interviewed and
denied providing permission for Staff 1 to provide items to Youth
A. Therapist was interviewed and reported only giving permission
for a specific item and denied providing permission for Staff 1 to
purchase Youth A clothes, candy or hair extensions.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4130 Privacy and confidentiality.
Section (1) An institution shall assure resident and parent privacy and
Description confidentiality and shall protect residents from exploitation.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On an unknown date, a staff member was on the phone with an
unknown adult male. The staff member then let a youth talk to the
unknown male on the phone. The staff member took a picture of
the youth sitting and sent it to the unknown man. On several
unknown dates and times the youth was allowed to talk to the
10

unknown man in a bathroom at the facility. There are no cameras
in the bathroom. The conversations were never of a sexual
nature, but the male would tell the youth that they were going to
adopt her. When the staff member previously accompanied the
youth to the hospital for mental health, they would let the youth
talk to unknown men over the phone. This was recently reported
to staff and it is unknown if they took any action.
Investigation Interviews:
On 06/11/2025 an onsite visit was made to Visita Maria. DHHS
Specialist was also present. An interview was completed with
Staff 1. Staff 1 denied allowing Youth A speak to anyone on her
cell phone, specifically an unknown male. She also denied ever
taking pictures of Youth A and denied she ever shared pictures of
Youth A with anyone. She further denied that she showed Youth A
her cell phone and denied that she shared her ear bud with Youth
A.
On 06/11/2025 an in-person meeting was held with Staff 2 at
Vista Maria. DHHS Specialist was also present. Staff 2 reported
that Youth A told her that Staff 1 would be on the phone talking to
an unknown male and Staff 1 would be saying things like “guess
what your daughter did”. She also reported that Youth A stated
that Staff 1 would put the unknown male on speaker phone and he
would say things like they were going to buy her a dress. Youth A
reported it felt “weird and uncomfortable”.
On 07/23/2025 an in-person interview was completed with Youth
B at Vista Maria. She confirmed that she has seen Staff 1 utilize
her cell phone at work, however denied knowledge of Staff 1
allowing Youth A talk to unknown individuals on her cell phone.
On 07/23/2025 an in-person interview was held with Youth C at
Vista Maria. She denied ever seeing Staff 1 utilize her cell phone
at work and denied knowledge of Staff 1 allowing Youth A to talk
to unknown individuals on her cell phone.
Documents Reviewed:
Vista Maria Employee Behavior Policy - Disclosure of confidential
information or taking videos, photos, of clients without proper
authorization is prohibited.
DHHS Specialist 2 Social Work Contact: Dated 06/11/2025.
Youth A reported that Staff 1 would face time unknown individuals
and then include her in the conversation. Staff 1 would tell the
individuals that they were at the hospital and turn the camera onto
11

her and the individuals would start asking her questions. Youth A
reported they would just ask her name, how things were going and
other basic kinds of questions. She did not recall anyone's names
from the calls, but said the calls occurred any time they were at
the hospital. Youth A also reported there was a man that Staff 1
had her talk to several times. It was not via a video call. Youth A
reported they would be on the unit and Staff 1 would pass her an
ear bud to talk to him. Youth A stated he sounded like an older
man based on his voice. She stated he would refer to her as his
daughter. Youth A reported the male knew a lot about her and
believed it was from Staff 1 telling him. Youth A recalled that once
he asked her about the dress she needed for a school dance.
Youth A also reported that Staff 1 took pictures of her when she
got her press on nails put on and when she fixed her hair
extensions. She reported she knew Staff 1 took the picture and
shared it because the man said how beautiful she looked with her
new hair and nails. Youth A denied that the conversations with
the unknown male were ever sexual in nature.
DHHS Specialist 1 Social Work Contact: Dated 06/23/2025. Staff
3 and Staff 4 denied knowledge of Staff 1 disclosing personal or
confidential information about Youth A to non-Vista individuals.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in compliance with the licensing rule. Both staff and youth were
interviewed and there was not sufficient evidence to support non-
compliance by the agency.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention: (a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to: (ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Two weeks ago, the staff member and youth were arguing and it
escalated to where the staff member put their hands around the
youth's neck in the bathroom. The youth lost breath.
Investigation Interviews:
On 06/05/2025 a telephone call was made to Worker 2. She
reported that she speaks with Youth A daily. She reported Youth
12

A advised her that Staff 1 put her hands around her neck while
they were in the bathroom and caused her to loose breath.
On 06/11/2025 an onsite visit was made to Visita Maria. DHHS
Specialist was also present. An interview was completed with
Staff 1. Staff 1 confirmed that there was an incident involving
Youth A in the bathroom but denied placing her hands around the
neck of Youth A or saying that she was going to kill her. She
reported that Youth A was upset and was in the restroom and
would not come out. Staff 1 reported Youth A became upset and
pushed her nails into her hand. Staff 1 reported she grabbed
Youth A by the wrist in an attempt to get her to take her nails out
of her skin. Staff 1 stated she held the wrist of Youth A for about
15 seconds and then they both let go. Staff 1 recalled that Youth
A attempted to spit on her. Staff 1 denied ever being physically
inappropriate with Youth A.
On 06/11/2025 an in-person meeting was held with Staff 2 at
Vista Maria. DHHS Specialist was also present. Staff 2 reported
that Youth A told her that Staff 2 “hemmed” her up in the bathroom
and told her that she would “kill her” if she ever did that. Staff 2
was unable to recall or advise what Youth A was referencing when
she said, “if she ever did that” and did not have a specific
definition of what “hemmed up” meant. Staff 2 denied witnessing
this behavior firsthand and denied seeing or having knowledge of
Staff 1 being physically aggressive with youth at the facility.
On 06/24/2025 and 07/11/2025 voicemail messages were left for
Staff 3 requesting a return call. On 08/06/2025 a successful
telephone call was made to Staff 3. She denied seeing Staff 1 be
physically aggressive with Youth A or any other youth. She also
denied that Youth A reported to her that Staff 1 put her hands
around her neck and made her lose consciousness or hit her.
On 06/24/2025 a voicemail message was left for Staff 4
requesting a return call. On 07/11/2025 an attempted call was
unsuccessful. A recording indicated the contact number was
inoperable. On 08/06/2025 a voicemail message was left and a
text message was sent requesting a return call. To date, no
response has been received.
Documents Reviewed:
Vista Maria Employee Behavior Policy - Prohibited Behavior: The
following behaviors are prohibited, and employees who engage in
prohibited acts are subject to discipline, up to and including
termination (see Disciplinary Procedure, 022-110):
13

- Fighting, assaulting, threatening or intimidating co-workers,
security, clients, customers, or guests.
- Vista Maria strictly prohibits excessive or inappropriate use
of behavior management intervention. Behavior
management interventions will not be used as a form of
discipline or to force compliance, for the convenience of
staff, or for property damage that does not involve
threatening danger to self or others.
- All forms of physical and/or verbal abuse are prohibited
- Undignified language, cursing and swearing are viewed as
verbal abuse and are prohibited.
- Spanking, paddling, slapping, pinching, twisting of arms,
pulling hair, etc. are also abusive and prohibited.
DHHS Specialist 2 Social Work Contact: Dated 06/11/2025.
Youth A recalled going into the bathroom and started to try to
break some tiles off the wall. Staff 1 came in and got between her
and the stall door. Youth A reported she tried to go toward another
staff and was pushed by Staff 1. I was later able to confirm that
the other staff was Staff 4. Youth A then stated she threatened to
spit on Staff 1 if she did not move. Staff 1 then grabbed her with
both of her hands on the throat and pushed her against the wall of
the bathroom. Youth A also reported Staff 1 squeezed her throat
causing her to have trouble breathing. To get Staff 1 to stop, she
dug her nails into Youth A’s hands and she was eventually
released. Youth A denied having any injuries as a result of this
incident. She did not tell anyone initially as she said she thought
Staff 1 would do something worse to her.
DHHS Specialist 1 Social Work Contact: Dated 06/23/2025. Staff
3 denied that Youth A disclosed any inappropriate behavior or
harm at the hands of Staff 1. Staff 4 denied seeing Staff 1
physically assault Youth A or any other youth at the facility. He
recalled being called to assist Staff 1 in the bathroom because
Youth A was trying to “cut herself”. Staff 4 reported he assisted
Staff 1 in calming Youth A down with verbal redirection and Youth
A handed over the broken tiles that she was threatening to cut
herself with. Staff 4 reported he then left and went back to his
assigned area.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in compliance with the licensing rules. Both staff and youth were
interviewed and there was not sufficient evidence to confirm that
staff had placed her hands around the neck of Youth A causing
her to lose consciousness.
14

Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention: (a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to: (iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth's
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation and Additional Findings of non-
Type compliance
Allegation Allegation #1:
The staff member used derogatory language and would insult the
youth.
Allegation #2:
The staff member made a threat to youth.
Investigation Interviews:
Allegation #1
